[{'created': '2019-08-13 18:23:58.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent double-attachment race in attachment_reserve

If multiple attachments are requested simultaneously,
a volume can be attached to an instance more than once.

This fixes this problem by detecting that a race has
occurred in _attachment_reserve, and backing out one of
the invalid attachment records.

This means that if the attachment API is called
repeatedly and quickly for the same volume, some requests
may fail, but this is much better than incorrectly
creating multiple attachments.

Closes-Bug: #1833736

Change-Id: Ic2463338b698c5cf805c0ae06d0229f54f64b3fc
(cherry picked from commit 7f3a77b66f9aa1b185310c8cbe33b358da6cc39a)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/attachments/test_attachments_api.py
(cherry picked from commit 5f9c93b194a2925bc2813ed766d320ecc88dfd26)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent double-attachment race in attachment_reserve

If multiple attachments are requested simultaneously,
a volume can be attached to an instance more than once.

This fixes this problem by detecting that a race has
occurred in _attachment_reserve, and backing out one of
the invalid attachment records.

This means that if the attachment API is called
repeatedly and quickly for the same volume, some requests
may fail, but this is much better than incorrectly
creating multiple attachments.

Closes-Bug: #1833736

Change-Id: Ic2463338b698c5cf805c0ae06d0229f54f64b3fc
(cherry picked from commit 7f3a77b66f9aa1b185310c8cbe33b358da6cc39a)
(cherry picked from commit eadff0df7efbe662bf107f77e1b2ac96c912e4e0)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/attachments/test_attachments_api.py
(cherry picked from commit 5f9c93b194a2925bc2813ed766d320ecc88dfd26)

commit_message:
Don't use 'assert' keyword in unit tests

Results of tests shouldn't change depending on whether you are running
with asserts enabled or not.

Change-Id: Ie231e3cccec9df19ce8eff8b89ed8828424fd120

commit_message:
Remove storage management network from controllers

There is no need to connect controllers nodes to the storage management
network by default. It should only be used by storage nodes.

Change-Id: I6fa7640658fd112aaddbe08c4af01711fb1f7916
Story: 2006273
Task: 35973

messages: [{'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-08-14 07:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-08-14 08:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28543, 'date': '2019-08-14 09:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-08-14 15:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-08-14 18:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 07:49:12.000000000', 'message': "Retroactively update improve-extraroute-api spec

As we discovered during implementation it wasn't a good idea of mine to
make the request and response body a list on the top level. Neither the
documentation tools nor python-neutronclient were prepared for non-dict
request/response bodies.

Another reason I suspect to always have dict-wrapped bodies is that it
makes possible future changes to the request/response format a bit easier.

Yet another reason is that the request/response body format in this change
is now the exact same as it was used in the PUT /v2.0/routers/router-id
request/response. Therefore clients wishing to use the new API only have
to change the URL, but not the body of their requests.

Since the api-def was already merged, this change just retroactively
updates the spec to avoid possible future confusion between the spec
and the api-ref.

Change-Id: I3c7e9ab4ab6518eb1d30e3711a2d9571dfc2fa15
Partial-Bug: #1826396
"}]
commit_message:
Retroactively update improve-extraroute-api spec

As we discovered during implementation it wasn't a good idea of mine to
make the request and response body a list on the top level. Neither the
documentation tools nor python-neutronclient were prepared for non-dict
request/response bodies.

Another reason I suspect to always have dict-wrapped bodies is that it
makes possible future changes to the request/response format a bit easier.

Yet another reason is that the request/response body format in this change
is now the exact same as it was used in the PUT /v2.0/routers/router-id
request/response. Therefore clients wishing to use the new API only have
to change the URL, but not the body of their requests.

Since the api-def was already merged, this change just retroactively
updates the spec to avoid possible future confusion between the spec
and the api-ref.

Change-Id: I3c7e9ab4ab6518eb1d30e3711a2d9571dfc2fa15
Partial-Bug: #1826396

[{'created': '2019-08-12 12:03:51.000000000', 'message': "Make sure the port still in port map when prepare_port_filter

The current code will remove the port from sg_port_map, but then it
won't be added into the map, when we resize/migrate this instance,
the related openflow won't be deleted, this will cause vm connectivity
problem.

Closes-Bug: #1825295
Change-Id: I94ddddda3c1960d43893c7a367a81279d429e469
(cherry picked from commit 82782d37639fab97e445e4bbb4daeb85dc829fcd)
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure the port still in port map when prepare_port_filter

The current code will remove the port from sg_port_map, but then it
won't be added into the map, when we resize/migrate this instance,
the related openflow won't be deleted, this will cause vm connectivity
problem.

Closes-Bug: #1825295
Change-Id: I94ddddda3c1960d43893c7a367a81279d429e469
(cherry picked from commit 82782d37639fab97e445e4bbb4daeb85dc829fcd)

commit_message:
Collect relevant files related to tempest

It will help to reduce load on rdo log server[1.]
Not to collect following files:
- .stackviz venv does not adds value
- tempest/tempest.* as tempest.html file is already in log root dir.
- etc/*.sample as .sample files does not adds value.

[1.] https://lists.rdoproject.org/pipermail/dev/2019-August/009121.html

Change-Id: I64801caa9d71ef496a8337bba203877006be849f
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 05:40:17.000000000', 'message': "Numvfs setting during update/upgrade

Earlier numvfs is set by puppet-tripleo. Now during update/upgrade,
the numvfs setting and persistence across reboot shall be managed
by os-net-config with the corresponding setting of numvfs via

commit_message:
Numvfs setting during update/upgrade

Earlier numvfs is set by puppet-tripleo. Now during update/upgrade,
the numvfs setting and persistence across reboot shall be managed
by os-net-config with the corresponding setting of numvfs via
nic-configs. However the numvfs value can't be changed during
the update/upgrade.

Change-Id: I717d822eb64f95c129bcfd66b553784643333f0e
(cherry picked from commit d9ea668972d192db3e78a493890522d0d10902a1)

commit_message:
CI: Sanity check that nodepool.private_ipv4 is assigned

During the MariaDB testing we saw a number of cases where this IP
address was not assigned to one or more hosts, which caused various
issues later on.

[{'created': '2019-08-07 12:16:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add NovaLocalMetadataPerCell cell support

Indicates that the nova-metadata API service has been deployed
per-cell, so that we can have better performance and data isolation
in a multi-cell deployment. Users should consider the use of this
configuration depending on how neutron is setup. If networks span
cells, you might need to run nova-metadata API service globally.
If your networks are segmented along cell boundaries, then you can
run nova-metadata API service per cell.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/675070
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/650943

'}, {'created': '2019-08-07 15:22:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add NovaLocalMetadataPerCell cell support

Indicates that the nova-metadata API service has been deployed
per-cell, so that we can have better performance and data isolation
in a multi-cell deployment. Users should consider the use of this
configuration depending on how neutron is setup. If networks span
cells, you might need to run nova-metadata API service globally.
If your networks are segmented along cell boundaries, then you can
run nova-metadata API service per cell.

If NovaAdditionalCell and NovaLocalMetadataPerCell is true, the
ovn-metadata-agent points to the nova metadata service on the
cell controller.

If NovaAdditionalCell is true but NovaLocalMetadataPerCell false
the ovn-metadata-agent points to the central control plane nova
metadata service.

If NovaAdditionalCell is falls the ovn-metadata-agent points to
the central control plane nova metadata service.

commit_message:
Add NovaLocalMetadataPerCell cell support

Indicates that the nova-metadata API service has been deployed
per-cell, so that we can have better performance and data isolation
in a multi-cell deployment. Users should consider the use of this
configuration depending on how neutron is setup. If networks span
cells, you might need to run nova-metadata API service globally.
If your networks are segmented along cell boundaries, then you can
run nova-metadata API service per cell.

Introduces a new endpoint_map entry NovaMetadataInternal.

If NovaLocalMetadataPerCell is true, NovaMetadataCellInternal points
to the local cell endpoint.

If NovaLocalMetadataPerCell is false, NovaMetadataCellInternal points
to the central control plane nova metadata endpoint.

The NovaMetadataCellInternal endpoint is then used to configure the
nova-metadata api endpoint the ovn metadata agent points to.

Also removes setting the deprecated [DEFAULT]/nova_metadata_ip
hiera key and only uses [DEFAULT]/nova_metadata_host for the ovn
metadata agent.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/675070
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/650943
Change-Id: I78f6d30676ee166f84d8aca1609b376bb73e5f2c
Closes-Bug: #1823760

Change-Id: I1e05230e4105a3706f0662b0c203137d05ebf3d8

[{'created': '2019-08-03 14:49:41.000000000', 'message': "Fixes power-on failure for 'ilo' hardware type

Server fails to return success for power-on operation if no
bootable device is found.

(Note) Two tescases are added as testcases modified in master
branch cannot be modified here. This was required as the
configuration parameter [ilo]power_retry which was marked for
obsolescence in Stein release has been removed in Train release.

Change-Id: I0e6ab307ecd0caaf7b79edff67373be3490bfed7
Story: 2006288
Task: 35997
(cherry picked from commit 49140989d185a021bc346ea55d7a63b91541baac)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes power-on failure for 'ilo' hardware type

Server fails to return success for power-on operation if no
bootable device is found.

(Note) Two tescases are added as testcases modified in master
branch cannot be modified here. This was required as the
configuration parameter [ilo]power_retry which was marked for
obsolescence in Stein release has been removed in Train release.

Change-Id: I0e6ab307ecd0caaf7b79edff67373be3490bfed7
Story: 2006288
Task: 35997
(cherry picked from commit 49140989d185a021bc346ea55d7a63b91541baac)

Use python3-pyyaml package for RHEL 8

RHEL 8 uses python3-pyyaml instead of the PyYAML package.

Change-Id: Ic016d6d53124e5208b5ce32408cfdf531ca05444

commit_message:
Remove dead link

Sadly the referenced IPv6 tutorial isn't available anymore, so drop the
link and replace it with link to video with presentation about IPv6
and OpenStack given by Shannon McFarland in Barcelona Summit.

Change-Id: I01bd5f4ba348c91b256f7d5196399ab034675b69

messages:

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/676289/1 : FAILURE in 2h 12m 09s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-14 13:17:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Clean backport for a test-only fix, I'm just going to fast approve this."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 23:54:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix misuse of nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims

The nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims returns True or False.
It does not assert anything.
So the return value should be asserted in tests.

Add assertTrue where the nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims is called.

Change-Id: I49460ec3b572ee14b32229e771a5499ff91e8722
Closes-Bug: #1839853
(cherry picked from commit 5c1d9dcbb29f5a84d56c4e496b3111b4040cad13)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix misuse of nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims

The nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims returns True or False.
It does not assert anything.
So the return value should be asserted in tests.

Add assertTrue where the nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims is called.

Change-Id: I49460ec3b572ee14b32229e771a5499ff91e8722
Closes-Bug: #1839853
(cherry picked from commit 5c1d9dcbb29f5a84d56c4e496b3111b4040cad13)

commit_message:
Release openstacksdk 0.34.0

This picks up a bunch of features and fixes, including
- support for global_request_id I70964cdd79741703c0b9b911b3b2f27c248130f0
- `fields` in baremetal get_* resources I1f0abaec823be327e0e12a090155f97bc59e3489
- limiting service_types from oslo.config I3d16d17caa2e8a58b7064c54e930468288aa6ff1
- quieter passthrough proxies Ifd4f2fce59c76148807fb7390f68eaae179694c4

Change-Id: Ida9b63cdcd3f88fd3ed0a27cb0335e73058ba795

commit_message:
Use list tables

Reformat overlong table into a list-table to make it easier to edit.
The change contains no wording changes besides giving titles to the
list-tables.

Fix formatting for setup-devstack-source-dirs so that the variable does
not get displayed with a grey bar at
https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/zuul_roles.html#role-setup-devstack-source-dirs

Change-Id: I7378d46c507b1d86f1d5319655a55f2a8c5a8f60

[{'created': '2019-08-09 08:06:41.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent init_host test to interfere with other tests

The test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_crash_finish_revert_migration test
needs to simulate a compute host crash at a certain point. It stop the
exection at a certain point by injecting a sleep then simulating a
compute restart. However the sleep is just 30 seconds which allows the
stopped function to return while other functional tests are running in
the same test worker process making those tests fail in a weird way.

One simple solution is to add a big enough sleep to the test that will
never return before the whole functional test exection. This patch
proposes a millin seconds which is more than 277 hours. Similaraly how
the other test in this test package works. This solution is hackis but
simple. A better solution would be to further enhance the capabilities
of the functional test env supporting nova-compute service crash / kill
+ restart.

Change-Id: Ib0d142806804e9113dd61d3a7ec15a98232775c8
Closes-Bug: #1839515

commit_message:
Prevent init_host test to interfere with other tests

The test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_crash_finish_revert_migration test
needs to simulate a compute host crash at a certain point. It stops the
execution at a certain point by injecting a sleep then simulating a
compute restart. However the sleep is just 30 seconds which allows the
stopped function to return while other functional tests are running in
the same test worker process making those tests fail in a weird way.

One simple solution is to add a big enough sleep to the test that will
never return before the whole functional test execution. This patch
proposes a million seconds which is more than 277 hours. Similar to how
the other test in this test package works. This solution is hacky but
simple. A better solution would be to further enhance the capabilities
of the functional test env supporting nova-compute service crash / kill
+ restart.

Change-Id: Ib0d142806804e9113dd61d3a7ec15a98232775c8
Closes-Bug: #1839515

commit_message:
Updating the numbers for undercloud installation documentation

Changed a repositories document from txt to rst to properly render the rst
syntax within, and updated all references to that document.  Also updated the
installation document to properly process the auto configured numbering.

Change-Id: I7fad6e5f89023575c86fef70f2ee17c1543c546d
Closes-Bug: 1827829

[{'created': '2019-08-09 09:07:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed grab kolla patch rhel8 task for check job

Currently in container build check job running against
kolla project pulls kolla rhel8 patch and is rebased against
upstream master.

Where Kolla patch against which job is triggered never applied
due to upstream master. Zuul always sets the local master branch
with the patch under test, so it needs to rebase against origin
master instead of upstream master.

Change-Id: Iec836b6fa3748fca0000b77576388cc31f7e6016
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fixed grab kolla patch rhel8 task for check job

Currently in container build check job running against
kolla project pulls kolla rhel8 patch and is rebased against
upstream master so kolla patch in reviewed is never tested.

Let's rebase the kolla patch against kolla changes to test
the kolla patches.

Closes-Bug: #1840036

Change-Id: Iec836b6fa3748fca0000b77576388cc31f7e6016
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 12:18:08.000000000', 'message': "Support enabling the Octavia panel

The Kolla Docker image for Horizon is built with support for the Octavia
panel, but this isn't handled properly during deployment by
Kolla-Ansible.

This commit adds the necessary options to configure this support when
Octavia itself has been enabled.

Change-Id: I60f1a52de71519f2d8bd84baa8aba5700fa75b1c
"}, {'created': '2019-08-14 08:43:20.000000000', 'message': 'Enable the Octavia panel in Horizon

This commit adds the missing policy file for Octavia
in Horizon, and enables the panel by adding it to
the list of services.

Change-Id: I60f1a52de71519f2d8bd84baa8aba5700fa75b1c
'}, {'created': '2019-08-14 12:01:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing Octavia policy file to Horizon

This commit adds the missing policy file for Octavia
in Horizon, thus enabling the panel where appropriate.

Change-Id: I60f1a52de71519f2d8bd84baa8aba5700fa75b1c
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing Octavia policy file to Horizon

This commit adds the missing policy file for Octavia
in Horizon, thus enabling the panel where appropriate.

Change-Id: I60f1a52de71519f2d8bd84baa8aba5700fa75b1c

Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Story: #2005924
Task: #34234

commit_message:
Increase wait reboot timeout

By this patch we increase to 800 seconds the wait for
undercloud after OS upgrade reboot

Change-Id: Ieccdfed5e5c78271a30cd3b67762ad4eb7578028
(cherry picked from commit e0955a391e6d1b80ddafe3a160353ca02cf606c9)

commit_message:
Update build jobs for Zuul changes

To better make the build results visible after recent changes
to how Zuul displays log files, add a zuul_return.

Change-Id: Ieb4b7b65c5dfbfd6a00ffafbf8f462de207fa455

commit_message:
Fix invalid assert state

"self.assertTrue(2, mock_load.call_count)" will never fail, and should
use assertEqual.

Change-Id: If99ef98f821d2df45fc03d4587d6c8c4953d7970

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-10 21:56:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix senlin cluster create

Calling openstacksdk's create_cluster no longer returns the action id in
the location.  Instead the caller has to use the cluster id to query the
cluster status and determine the execution status based on that.

Change-Id: Ia09915dc0529aaec21d0826f28e29d435354e5e0
Story: #2006201

commit_message:
Fix senlin cluster create

Calling openstacksdk's create_cluster no longer returns the action id in
the location.  Instead the caller has to use the cluster id to query the
cluster status and determine the execution status based on that.

Change-Id: Ia09915dc0529aaec21d0826f28e29d435354e5e0
Task: 35786

messages:
[{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-08-13 06:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-08-13 08:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Going to test this.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-08-13 08:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-08-13 08:50:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

would need some test on a selinux-enabled system, just to ensure we don't have have access issues with httpd. Not sure that service is allowed to access container_file_t.

-1 for now just to raise proper attention about that matter. Once it has been tested, we'll see :)."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-08-13 10:47:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck - strange error in CI tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode, no failed task during deployment but it returned rc == 1 , retrying to confirm the issue'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-08-13 12:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We can see here that SELinux is, indeed, not happy:
https://logs.opendev.org/02/676102/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers/d9740aa/logs/undercloud/var/log/extra/denials.txt.gz

See at the bottom:
type=AVC msg=audit(1565686206.524:9950): avc:  denied  { getattr } for  pid=6654 comm="httpd" path="/var/lib/image-serve/v2/index.json" dev="vda1" ino=6268331 scontext=system_u:system_r:httpd_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:container_file_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1

We need to authorize httpd_t to access container_file_t. Basically:
- getattr
- read
- open

IIRC there's a shortcut available (read_only_file or something). I'll propose a patch against selinux-openstack shortly.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-08-13 12:44:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Pull request against openstack-selinux (unfortunately hosted on github): https://github.com/redhat-openstack/openstack-selinux/pull/36'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-13 13:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Can we not add more mistral stuff? The point is to try and reduce our usage of it. Is it possible to use an external deployment task or something else to avoid having to do the container image prepare within mistral?'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-13 15:28:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I hate this but prior to podman, we ran this for docker. It worked because no file system was required. Now with podman we need to mount /var/lib/image-serve because we're writing to the filesystem."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-08-14 10:57:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

After a deep digging into the code and logs, I identified the source of the problem. And mainly, understood, why is this working for deployment but it isn't for the external update/upgrade run.
The reason is in the inventory used to run the Ansible playbooks. During deployment, we build the inventory with the following parameters: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/tripleo_common/actions/ansible.py#L683-L684 ,while during external update/upgrade we call the tripleo-ansible-inventory binary: https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/master/tripleoclient/utils.py#L1074-L1079 . We can see there that the --undercloud-connection is being passed to ssh. However, if we go to the tripleo-ansible-inventory code we see that the option isn't being used during the inventory creation: https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/src/branch/stable/stein/scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory#L131-L140 

The result, can be observed in any updates/upgrades job. If we go into /var/lib/mistral directory. The tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml from the overcloud deployment (https://logs.opendev.org/14/675814/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-upgrades/0c57b3a/logs/undercloud/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml.txt.gz) contains ansible_connection: ssh, ansible_ssh_user: tripleo-admin and the ansible_ssh_private_key_file, while in the external upgrade execution we use ansible_connection: local (https://logs.opendev.org/14/675814/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-upgrades/0c57b3a/logs/undercloud/var/lib/mistral/config-download-latest/inventory.yaml.txt.gz). The consequence of this is that during deployment, if we run a workflow from the mistral_executor container with target host the Undercloud, we'll connect to the undercloud via ssh and run the task in the Undercloud host. While in the external update/upgrade and even, I would say normal updates/upgraes, we run the tasks local to the mistral_executor container. Therefore, we can see the container images being stored in the mistral_executor container instead of the Undercloud host. 
I'll start working on the fixes for all of this."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This issue should get fixed by https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:fix_container_image_prepare+(status:open+OR+status:merged)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 06:16:11.000000000', 'message': "Mapping /var/lib/image-serve for containers images update.

In the update/upgrade process, we try to use the same
ContainerImagePrepare service it's been used during
deployment to update/upgrade the container images in
the registry [0]. This is done by executing the external
update/upgrade run command, in which we pass the tag
container_image_prepare. Ensuring these set of tasks get
executed [1]. However, when running the command, we observe
that the container images are being pulled but we don't get
to see them in /var/lib/image-serve/v2/rhos15 in the Undercloud.
The reason is, because those images are being stored in the
mistral_executor's container /var/lib/image-serve directory
instead. Mapping the containers volume to the Undercloud's one
solves the issue.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/stein/deployment/container-image-prepare/container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml
[1] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/stein/deployment/container-image-prepare/container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml#L98

Closes-Bug: #1832932
Change-Id: I8a6b32ef9f6a8ad973900175fcd66cd9c01dc4f7
"}]
commit_message:
Mapping /var/lib/image-serve for containers images update.

In the update/upgrade process, we try to use the same
ContainerImagePrepare service it's been used during
deployment to update/upgrade the container images in
the registry [0]. This is done by executing the external
update/upgrade run command, in which we pass the tag
container_image_prepare. Ensuring these set of tasks get
executed [1]. However, when running the command, we observe
that the container images are being pulled but we don't get
to see them in /var/lib/image-serve/v2/rhos15 in the Undercloud.
The reason is, because those images are being stored in the
mistral_executor's container /var/lib/image-serve directory
instead. Mapping the containers volume to the Undercloud's one
solves the issue.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/stein/deployment/container-image-prepare/container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml
[1] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/stein/deployment/container-image-prepare/container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml#L98

Closes-Bug: #1832932
Change-Id: I8a6b32ef9f6a8ad973900175fcd66cd9c01dc4f7

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fix designate config

The changes in [0] sadly were almost, but not quite, completely broken.
They introduced config options that do not exist in designate and also
made secrets being saved into the node config.

Fix all this, also clean up the remainder of a workaround that is no
longer needed.

This was partially fixed for stable/queens in [1].

backport: stable/queens

[0] If4e185eb58a525e22971c7a8b876274c353db847
[1] https://review.opendev.org/606094

Change-Id: I5ccb4fa5d8f3a003c4dd1b07e1c9ab2a99246dd6

In Kubernetes the <namespace>-<name> pair is guaranteed to be unique, so I'd rather use that instead of uid, especially as it's easier to lookup pod events by name in kubelet logs."}, {'account_id': 29615, 'date': '2019-07-18 00:37:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> In Kubernetes the <namespace>-<name> pair is guaranteed to be
 > unique, so I'd rather use that instead of uid, especially as it's
 > easier to lookup pod events by name in kubelet logs.

Yes agreed but two instances of the same Pod (you created the Pod, deleted it and then recreated it) will have same name but different uids. Hence using uids allows us to differentiate between logs for such cases."}, {'account_id': 29615, 'date': '2019-08-05 11:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-08-08 16:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 23:57:30.000000000', 'message': 'Replace ``python-apt`` functionality

The ``python-apt`` package is a wrapper around the ``apt`` C++
library which is tightly connected to the version of the
distribution it is shipped on.

This in turn makes it incredibly hard to distribute as a wheel for
a charm that supports a large span of distro versions.

We do not want to rely on system installed Python packages but
distribute the direct charm dependencies as part of the charms
wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see discussion in LP: #1824112 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: I292dcba7cf2de18e53ae80339d07c6e1fe5c90fc

commit_message:
Replace ``python-apt`` functionality

The ``python-apt`` package is a wrapper around the ``apt`` C++
library which is tightly connected to the version of the
distribution it is shipped on.

This in turn makes it incredibly hard to distribute as a wheel for
a charm that supports a large span of distro versions.

We do not want to rely on system installed Python packages but
distribute the direct charm dependencies as part of the charms
wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see discussion in LP: #1824112 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: I292dcba7cf2de18e53ae80339d07c6e1fe5c90fc

[{'account_id': 30272, 'date': '2019-08-08 17:21:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-08 17:21:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

Does default user (used by telegraf) in docker group to be able to access docker.sock?'}, {'account_id': 30272, 'date': '2019-08-12 11:25:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (venv3) 06:24 (220s) hrw@j13-qrep-04:kolla$ ls -l /var/run/docker*

I wanted to submit this patch ahead of time but leave it defaulted off just to get the framework in place in kolla-ansible."}, {'account_id': 30272, 'date': '2019-08-13 12:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-08-14 11:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2019-08-14 11:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-08-14 12:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-14 12:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Configure Telegraf to monitor Docker containers

Added configuration to ansible/roles/telegraf/templates/telegraf.conf.j2 to
allow telegraf to grab telemetry data from docker directly.

Added option to etc/kolla/globals.yml to switch on/off the configuration to
ingest data from the docker daemon into telegraf.

Change-Id: Icbebc415d643a237fa128840d5f5a9c91d22c12d
Signed-off-by: Keith Plant <kplantjr@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ansible: fix partition_configdrive for logical root_devices

If the node root_device is a logical drive (like an md array, or a
logical volume), partition_configdrive.sh was not working correctly.

Change-Id: Ida4f91efba0f38f20cd80dd6b6162a77af8d6b78
Story: #2006334
Task: #36082

commit_message:
Use keystone v3 instead of v2

This patch replaces parameters for keystone v2 in README and
test codes by the ones for keystone v3, as currently keystone
v2 should not be used anymore.

Change-Id: I6b063dd980e414bfb7c7a94612076690daa85b2d

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I3c2f26c1199acd5e0dd3663e4b77f3ee1af072c7
Story: #2005924
Task: #34217

commit_message:
Refactor docker stop on upgrade tasks

There are cases when docker cannot stop the container. This patch
refactors to have a visibility what went wrong.

Change-Id: I077cd5c3abf5f3217c0af2e1c0e88ee3f27a5c65

commit_message:
Docs: Jenkins is dead, long live Zuul

Cinder does not use Jenkins for quite some time anymore, update the
information for Zuul.

Fix also an aligment problem and a formatting bug (_x_ is
not RST markup) in file i18n.rst.

Change-Id: Icaa26764041106ad95eb69b7a94400429e025bd9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-01 13:17:36.000000000', 'message': 'Removes agent mixin from oneview drivers

This patch removes the agent mixin interface from oneview
drivers and adds a flag based solution instead. Once a set
boot device operation needs to be performed, the operation
is stored to driver_internal_info until the server power
on. Before power the server on again, the operation stored
is performed and then the server is powered on.

Change-Id: I8dabf7ef1ff6e44c062310c5cb3509e545585c0a
Closes-Bug: #1503855
Co-Authored-By: Fellype Cavalcante <fellypefca@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
(cherry picked from commit 8f45317d4345872c050b2fa347f7be033556d2f5)

commit_message:
Removes agent mixin from oneview drivers

This patch removes the agent mixin interface from oneview
drivers in ocata to enable the drivers to perform multitenancy
operations.

Change-Id: I8dabf7ef1ff6e44c062310c5cb3509e545585c0a
Closes-Bug: #1716023
Co-Authored-By: Fellype Cavalcante <fellypefca@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
(cherry picked from commit 8f45317d4345872c050b2fa347f7be033556d2f5)

commit_message:
DNM WIP wsgi ironic-api in devstack

Don't review it's test to devstack only for grenade run ironic-api with
wsgi, to run it we need add in local.conf new variables:
IRONIC_USE_MOD_WSGI=True

Change-Id: I9c5ad56e1acd292ff0f9cc9b460125fc420abda7

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Co-Authored-By: qingszhao <zhao.daqing@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: I2b447c801291c78a70a6c9e362c7e63a2890986b

commit_message:
Fix retaging of ovn-dbs container during update.

The variable name was wrong, and the retaging was not taking place
leading to ovn dbs being stopped on the cluster after update.

Change-Id: I9f3502be850a48f2aaf018c7cde0fea253a1513a
Closes-Bug: #1839635
(cherry picked from commit e7c02f9d4a7ac561f1dc7286ede130a0d827ba34)

commit_message:
Add support for Swift S3 API

This feature is disabled by default, and can be enabled by setting
'enable_swift_s3api' to 'true' in globals.yml.

Two middlewares are required for Swift S3 - s3api and s3token. Additionally, we
need to configure the authtoken middleware to delay auth decisions to give
s3token a chance to authorise requests using EC2 credentials.

Change-Id: Ib8e8e3a1c2ab383100f3c60ec58066e588d3b4db

 > Pike, the first moment where this appeared.
 > 
 > Should we communicate to them?

This change is reflected back to Ocata

It would break Newton (which I beleive is older than this project?)

https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/ocata/upper-constraints.txt#L130'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2019-05-29 22:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-31 06:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-31 06:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > There are still ppl that are using loci to build things before
 > > Pike, the first moment where this appeared.
 > >
 > > Should we communicate to them?
 > 
 > This change is reflected back to Ocata
 > 
 > It would break Newton (which I beleive is older than this project?)
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/ocata/upper-constraints.txt#L130

Yes, OSH is using LOCI to build newton images. However I thought of that before, and I proposed the removal of newton at the last PTG, and I have proposed [1].

I would like [1] to merge first, before I can vote positively on this.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662390/'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-31 06:33:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-31 09:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I would like to wait a little before merging this, as it will break OSH, until the patch I commented here would be merged.

The Depends-On: would only be semantic, so I am not sure the commit message needs adapting. I am just doing a -1 administratively.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2019-05-31 20:07:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> I would like to wait a little before merging this, as it will break

commit_message:
Remove explict enum-compat

This bug was fixed in requirements repo a while back.
upper-constraints.txt contains a constraint for enum-compat now and we
do not need to explicity call it out anymore.

Related-Id: I7c8bfbb89f13db1c251e762dfaf2020fa1f2fdc8
Change-Id: I42b9f3d253e2062a5e2ec92ae24be88d24617f3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-16 04:22:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix systemd-journal-remote socket dependency

After I426dc8c29987e7b034a656e7d81321655ed6dbe2, a new installation
of systemd-journal-remote would fail to start, entering a restart
loop because of:
systemd-journal-remote[5089]: Received fewer sockets than expected

This is because the commit introduced a regression where the service
unit no longer depended on the socket, so systemd was not starting
the journal listening socket.

  systemd-journal-remote.socket - Journal Remote Sink Socket
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-journal-remote.socket;
           disabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: inactive (dead)
   Listen: [::]:19532 (Stream)

Fixing this bug causes the socket to activate as expected when the
systemd-journal-remote service starts:

  systemd-journal-remote.socket - Journal Remote Sink Socket
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-journal-remote.socket;
           disabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: active (running) since Thu 2019-05-16 00:17:29 EDT; 4min 45s ago
   Listen: [::]:19532 (Stream)
    Tasks: 0 (limit: 8192)
   CGroup: /system.slice/systemd-journal-remote.socket

May 16 00:17:29 infra1 systemd[1]: Listening on Journal Remote Sink Socket.

Change-Id: Ie0e2f376bd6a16f88801611b77fcfde5003d68e2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix systemd-journal-remote socket dependency

After I426dc8c29987e7b034a656e7d81321655ed6dbe2, a new installation
of systemd-journal-remote would fail to start, entering a restart
loop because of:
systemd-journal-remote[5089]: Received fewer sockets than expected

This is because the commit introduced a regression where the service
unit no longer depended on the socket, so systemd was not starting
the journal listening socket.

  systemd-journal-remote.socket - Journal Remote Sink Socket
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-journal-remote.socket;
           disabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: inactive (dead)
   Listen: [::]:19532 (Stream)

Fixing this bug causes the socket to activate as expected when the
systemd-journal-remote service starts:

  systemd-journal-remote.socket - Journal Remote Sink Socket
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/systemd-journal-remote.socket;
           disabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: active (running) since Thu 2019-05-16 00:17:29 EDT; 4min 45s ago
   Listen: [::]:19532 (Stream)
    Tasks: 0 (limit: 8192)
   CGroup: /system.slice/systemd-journal-remote.socket

May 16 00:17:29 infra1 systemd[1]: Listening on Journal Remote Sink Socket.

Change-Id: Ie0e2f376bd6a16f88801611b77fcfde5003d68e2

Typically when adding a new requirement, that would mean incrementing the version to 1.1.0 to signal that there are changes that the packager or deployed needs to be aware of.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-07 15:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Waiting to see this answered before voting.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-07 15:22:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Waiting for this to be answered, even if it's docs. Waiting to see a stable review too."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-08-07 15:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

To my knowledge those were added to the docs requirements in response to a change in the docs jobs/nodepool setup. Past the stable review day. We have two +2s from normal (unstable?) reviewers and it's a small set of pretty safe looking changes, so pushing through."}]

commit_message:
ironic: take over instances from down compute services

This updates the hash ring refresh to take over instances that land on
the current service on the hash ring, if the instance's compute service
is down. This minimizes the time that an instance cannot be managed when
a compute service is lost.

Change-Id: Idf83f604a08b236348a66076f3470eda1c8dc8b8

but I think the problem is paunch wants --enable-now too fast for the configured services. No config changes would help here.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-08-12 13:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(but only disabling rate limiting or learning paunch to rate limit itself)'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-08-12 13:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

there's also the "systemctl reset-failed <service>" that can be used in order to reset the fail-count.

Disabling rate limit smells like a bad idea, since it might create some instability on the node (load, for instance). Not sure this is the right approach :/'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-08-12 13:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Hello,

I think that using tenacity to manage this it's a good idea, but I had introduce the `systemctl` module in the past to wrap the systemctl CLI and I think that we are out of the scope of this module with these changes.

commit_message:
Fix systemd service start rate limiting

The default limit is to allow 5 restarts in a 10sec period. If a
service goes over that threshold due to the Restart= config option in
the service definition, it will not attempt to restart any further.

We should not set StartLimitIntervalSec to 0 to disable any kind of
rate limiting as that may end up impacting the node load.

Instead, use tenacity to retry with an exponential backoff, when the
service unit enablement fails. Before to retry it, reset the unit's
failure counters with the systemctl wrapper. This is a crash-loop
approach that provides an efficient feature parity to the classic
rate limiting, shall we want to implement that for the systemctl
command wrapper instead.

Closes-bug: #1839841

Change-Id: I537fbf9933f2cbe6e1c2f627ba77da645bd55f25
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix misuse of nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims

The nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims returns True or False.
It does not assert anything.
So the return value should be asserted in tests.

Add assertTrue where the nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims is called.

Change-Id: I49460ec3b572ee14b32229e771a5499ff91e8722
Closes-Bug: #1839853

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-09 21:54:37.000000000', 'message': 'rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
'}, {'created': '2019-08-12 16:29:01.000000000', 'message': 'rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
'}]
commit_message:
rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674

commit_message:
Avoid timeout from service update notification tests

Since If32bca070185937ef83f689b7163d965a89ec10a some of the service
update notification tests are slow because setting a compute enabled or
disabled makes an RPC call to the given compute service. These tests
does not have the proper RPC setup so that call times out. Since the
notification is still generated the test passes. Waiting for this
timeout steals 16 minutes of test execution time unnecessary.

This patch stubs the RPC call as that is not necessary for the
notification testing and therefore speeds up the tests.

Change-Id: I0269c4bd3da0e58593811b11985deb237eefe59e

commit_message:
service_setup: refactor service setup to a single file

This patch refactors the openstack user/service/endpoints creation to
service_setup.yml which will eventually be managed by
openstack-ansible-tests.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/675353
Change-Id: I50fab53db1e2f7b6093333475c672928301e8a30

[{'created': '2019-08-13 17:02:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add bindep.txt

The Vault functional tests are currently failing in the gate, and it
appears to be because the unzip binary is not present. We need to
add it to bindep so it will be installed before running tests.

Change-Id: I4b8075429218a494f75f5e3611f48927d18f1700
Closes-Bug: 1840061
'}]
commit_message:
Add bindep.txt

The Vault functional tests are currently failing in the gate, and it
appears to be because the unzip binary is not present. We need to
add it to bindep so it will be installed before running tests.

Change-Id: I4b8075429218a494f75f5e3611f48927d18f1700
Closes-Bug: 1840061

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-10 08:24:09.000000000', 'message': "Update docs building

Cleanup doc/requirements to just use what is needed for doc building.
Move reno to doc/requirements, add doc8 to test-requirements.

update tox.ini:
* doc8 should be in pep8 as linter and not docs according to PTI [1]
* Only build main doc in docs environment, CI uses this and we waste
  just time building api-ref as well, there's a separate environment for
  this. This follows PTI [1]
* Do not include requirements file for docs building, it's not needed
  with apidoc.

Cleanup doc/source/conf.py, with the switch to api-doc a lot of settings
are not needed anymore.

Update openstackdocstheme to 1.20.0 and which allows to remove obsolete
setting of html_last_updated_fmt and project from conf.py.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: If86dd619402495d9d4470b14cb270fcf53db6794
"}, {'created': '2019-08-10 08:26:59.000000000', 'message': "Update docs building

Cleanup doc/requirements to just use what is needed for doc building.
Move reno to doc/requirements, add doc8 to test-requirements.

update tox.ini:
* doc8 should be in pep8 as linter and not docs according to PTI [1]
* Only build main doc in docs environment, CI uses this and we waste
  just time building api-ref as well, there's a separate environment for
  this. This follows PTI [1]
* Do not include requirements file for docs building, it's not needed
  with apidoc.

Cleanup doc/source/conf.py, with the switch to api-doc a lot of settings
are not needed anymore.

Update openstackdocstheme to 1.20.0 and which allows to remove obsolete
setting of html_last_updated_fmt, project, latex_elements from conf.py.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: If86dd619402495d9d4470b14cb270fcf53db6794
"}, {'created': '2019-08-10 08:46:55.000000000', 'message': "Update docs building

Cleanup doc/requirements to just use what is needed for doc building.
Move reno to doc/requirements, add doc8 to test-requirements.

update tox.ini:
* doc8 should be in pep8 as linter and not docs according to PTI [1]
* Only build main doc in docs environment, CI uses this and we waste
  just time building api-ref as well, there's a separate environment for
  this. This follows PTI [1]
* Do not include requirements file for docs building, it's not needed
  with apidoc.
* Use common deps for all docs build environments.

Cleanup doc/source/conf.py, with the switch to api-doc a lot of settings
are not needed anymore, also the eventlet bug is fixed.

Update openstackdocstheme to 1.20.0 and which allows to remove obsolete
setting of html_last_updated_fmt, project, latex_elements from conf.py.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: If86dd619402495d9d4470b14cb270fcf53db6794

commit_message:
Update docs building

Cleanup doc/requirements to just use what is needed for doc building.
Move reno to doc/requirements, add doc8 to test-requirements.

update tox.ini:
* doc8 should be in pep8 as linter and not docs according to PTI [1]
* Only build main doc in docs environment, CI uses this and we waste
  just time building api-ref as well, there's a separate environment for
  this. This follows PTI [1]
* Do not include requirements file for docs building, it's not needed
  with apidoc.
* Use common deps for all docs build environments.

Cleanup doc/source/conf.py, with the switch to api-doc a lot of settings
are not needed anymore, also the eventlet bug is fixed.

Update openstackdocstheme to 1.20.0 and which allows to remove obsolete
setting of html_last_updated_fmt, project, latex_elements from conf.py.

Add doc8 to lower-constraints to make requirments-check happy.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: If86dd619402495d9d4470b14cb270fcf53db6794

every build; it's just noise unless you're debugging the element
dependency solver itself.  Remove from output.

subject: Fix adding dependency package to environment with debreach
messages: [{'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2019-08-13 05:32:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-08-14 07:18:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThat's reasonable. Thanks, Andy"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 05:32:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix adding dependency package to environment with debreach

When using the debreach random comment middleware with Django,
the API response when adding a dependency package to an
environment would end up with a html-style comment at the end of
the response, which would then fail JSON parsing by the dashboard.

To prevent debreach from adding the random data, the content type
needs to be something other than text/html. The response output
itself isn't really JSON so switching to JsonResponse doesn't
work becuase the content isn't a dict, so just use text/plain
instead.

Change-Id: Ie710487d865344c9a5cd71d4dec3bf927cfabf40
"}]
commit_message:
Fix adding dependency package to environment with debreach

When using the debreach random comment middleware with Django,
the API response when adding a dependency package to an
environment would end up with a html-style comment at the end of
the response, which would then fail JSON parsing by the dashboard.

To prevent debreach from adding the random data, the content type
needs to be something other than text/html. The response output
itself isn't really JSON so switching to JsonResponse doesn't
work becuase the content isn't a dict, so just use text/plain
instead.

Change-Id: Ie710487d865344c9a5cd71d4dec3bf927cfabf40

Some docs used external links which cannot be verified and thus we have
broken links. Use internal links that Sphinx can verify.

Some additional updates:
* Update tox.ini to not publish the dirtrees.
* Update openstack mailing list to openstack-discuss
* Remove reference to not anymore existing 'OpenStack Configuration
  Reference'

Change-Id: I9a613fa682021fab7bbaba90b219adaa7d9384d3

Some docs used external links which cannot be verified and thus we
easily might get broken links. Use internal links that Sphinx can verify.

* Update tox.ini to not publish the dirtrees.
* Update openstack mailing list to openstack-discuss
* Remove reference to not anymore existing 'OpenStack Configuration
  Reference'

Change-Id: I9a613fa682021fab7bbaba90b219adaa7d9384d3
"}]
commit_message:
Docs: Make links more robust

Some docs used external links which cannot be verified and thus we
easily might get broken links. Use internal links that Sphinx can verify.

Some additional updates:
* Update tox.ini to not publish the dirtrees.
* Update openstack mailing list to openstack-discuss
* Remove reference to not anymore existing 'OpenStack Configuration
  Reference'

Change-Id: I9a613fa682021fab7bbaba90b219adaa7d9384d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-21 16:38:03.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Multiple API cleanup changes

Change-Id: I9d257a003d315b84b937dcef91f3cb41f3e24b53
Partial-Implements: blueprint api-consistency-cleanup
'}, {'created': '2019-06-25 18:05:52.000000000', 'message': 'Multiple API cleanup changes

This microversion implements below API cleanups:

1. 400 for unknown param for query param and for request body.

2. TODO: Making server representation always consistent among all APIs
   returning the complete server representation.

3. Change the default return value of ``swap`` field from the empty string
   to 0 (integer) in flavor APIs.

4. Return ``servers`` field always in the response of GET
   hypervisors API even there are no servers on hypervisor

Details: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/api-consistency-cleanup.html

Partial-Implements: blueprint api-consistency-cleanup

Change-Id: I9d257a003d315b84b937dcef91f3cb41f3e24b53

commit_message:
Multiple API cleanup changes

This microversion implements below API cleanups:

1. 400 for unknown param for query param and for request body.

2. Making server representation always consistent among all APIs
   returning the complete server representation.

3. Change the default return value of ``swap`` field from the empty string
   to 0 (integer) in flavor APIs.

4. Return ``servers`` field always in the response of GET
   hypervisors API even there are no servers on hypervisor

Details: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/api-consistency-cleanup.html

Partial-Implements: blueprint api-consistency-cleanup

Change-Id: I9d257a003d315b84b937dcef91f3cb41f3e24b53

subject: Support no-hostonly flag for dracut-regenerate
messages:
[{'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2019-08-10 03:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-12 04:35:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I remember we went through this before with I5d203f2abe743cb23a44d449850e692a948e7871 ... so we should be installing the dracut-config-generic package, which I believe should be making a generic initramfs.

Can you check if that's working?  Maybe it's an ordering issue or something? I'd like to understand what's going on"}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2019-08-12 06:27:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I remember we went through this before with I5d203f2abe743cb23a44d449850e692a948e7871
 > ... so we should be installing the dracut-config-generic package,
 > which I believe should be making a generic initramfs.
 > 
 > Can you check if that's working?  Maybe it's an ordering issue or
 > something? I'd like to understand what's going on

Hi, Ian, thanks for the information, i checked that dracut-config-generic was installed, but without --no-hostonly the system didn't boot correctly, no idea
what's wrong

[centos@baremetal-2 ~]$ rpm -qa|grep dracut
dracut-network-033-554.el7.aarch64
dracut-config-generic-033-554.el7.aarch64
dracut-033-554.el7.aarch64
dracut-config-rescue-033-554.el7.aarch64"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-12 07:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

could we see the build logs?  the only thing i can think is that somehow it gets installed after the initramfs is generated or something.  the package really should be doing what it says in the description:

 Description  : This package provides the configuration to turn off the host specific initramfs
              : generation with dracut and generates a generic image by default.'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2019-08-12 11:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

build log: https://gofile.io/?c=J0YjRB'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-12 12:07:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think I found the problem from that, there's a bunch of stuff

 2019-08-12 11:05:16.938 | cp: error writing '/var/tmp/dracut.rR0UQB/initramfs/usr/lib/firmware/cxgb4/t4fw-1.20.8.0.bin': No space left on device
 2019-08-12 11:05:16.939 | cp: failed to extend '/var/tmp/dracut.rR0UQB/initramfs/usr/lib/firmware/cxgb4/t4fw-1.20.8.0.bin': No space left on device
 2019-08-12 11:05:16.939 | dracut-install: ERROR: failed to create directory '/var/tmp/dracut.rR0UQB/initramfs/lib/firmware/mellanox'
 2019-08-12 11:05:16.940 | cp: error writing '/var/tmp/dracut.rR0UQB/initramfs/lib/firmware/phanfw.bin': No space left on device
 2019-08-12 11:05:16.940 | cp: failed to extend '/var/tmp/dracut.rR0UQB/initramfs/lib/firmware/phanfw.bin': No space left on device
 2019-08-12 11:05:16.941 | dracut-install: ERROR: failed to create directory '/var/tmp/dracut.rR0UQB/initramfs/lib/firmware/qed'

it looks like the dracut initramfs generation has failed.  so i'm not surprised that wouldn't boot.

i'm not sure why --no-hostonly would change that, perhaps space was made for the runs where you tried that?  or is something else changing between the two builds?"}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2019-08-12 13:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

oops, didn't notice this error, why build didn't fail even error occurred?

env DIB_IMAGE_EXTRA_SIZE=1000 was set for the working build with this patch.
i'll try this env without patching."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2019-08-12 13:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

confirmed that with env DIB_IMAGE_EXTRA_SIZE=1000, no issue booting, seems like auto calculated block device size is not enough for dracut. maybe a bigger value is needed here: https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/blob/master/diskimage_builder/lib/disk-image-create#L390'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-13 06:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> confirmed that with env DIB_IMAGE_EXTRA_SIZE=1000

That's interesting.  The root partition seems to be ~1.5gb (from "3:0:+1437M") although I can't see what the calculated disk size is.  Could you rerun this with "-x" enabled to get debug logs (it's probably worth always running with "-x", it doesn't output that much more)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-13 10:28:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> oops, didn't notice this error, why build didn't fail even error occurred?

yeah, it looks like we don't catch failures there correctly; see https://review.opendev.org/676032"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-14 06:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note I believe that https://review.opendev.org/676354 will help with the out of disk errors'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-10 03:03:21.000000000', 'message': 'Support no-hostonly flag for dracut-regenerate

Dracut will produce host-only initramfs images with the current hardware
by default[1], if we want to produce initramfs for all kinds of hardware
for baremetal, --no-hostonly flag is needed.

This patch adds an env `DIB_DRACUT_NO_HOSTONLY` to set --no-hostonly
flag when regenerating initramfs.

[1] https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Features/DracutHostOnly

Change-Id: I8511669e188717494daf2bc1384a6dd346f942a4
Closes-bug: #1839694
'}]
commit_message:
Support no-hostonly flag for dracut-regenerate

Dracut will produce host-only initramfs images with the current hardware
by default[1], if we want to produce initramfs for all kinds of hardware
for baremetal, --no-hostonly flag is needed.

This patch adds an env `DIB_DRACUT_NO_HOSTONLY` to set --no-hostonly
flag when regenerating initramfs.

[1] https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Features/DracutHostOnly

Change-Id: I8511669e188717494daf2bc1384a6dd346f942a4
Closes-bug: #1839694

commit_message:
Numvfs setting during update/upgrade

Earlier numvfs is set by puppet-tripleo. Now during update/upgrade,
the numvfs setting and persistence across reboot shall be managed
by os-net-config with the corresponding setting of numvfs via
nic-configs. However the numvfs value can't be changed during
the update/upgrade.

Change-Id: I717d822eb64f95c129bcfd66b553784643333f0e

commit_message:
Add services for testing based on test repo name

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Change-Id: I592d51171ecef5e30c54e71bf4c00d96787bce36

commit_message:
Update docs building

Switch to "modern" way of building docs using sphinx-build directly,
remove now unsed parts from setup.cfg.

Upgrade to openstackdocstheme 1.20 and remove obsolete variables from
conf.py.

Convert external links to internal RST links so that Sphinx can verify
that they are correct.

Replace redirected links with new targets.

Use opendev.org instead of github.com where appropriate.

Change-Id: Iedcc008b170821aa74acefc02ec6a243a0dc307c

commit_message:
Remove unused disk_capacity field

The fields disk and disk_capacity have the same value,
we just need one, so remove disk_capacity field.
Partially Implements: blueprint improve-compute-data-model

Change-Id: If3d385c5e61713bbdc85e22f10cd75e161ff79f0

commit_message:
Fix kwargs passed to exception to get better format of error message

kwargs should be passed to exception according to the definition of
exception format message, or we can just pass message to exception,
so this is to fix some inconsistencies of kwargs passed to exception
to get better format of error message.

Change-Id: I809725c1f8fd711b372406e64ba80f11505eb737

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-12 14:55:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add the ability to configure ovn-remote-probe-interval

This parameter sets inactive probe interval of the JSON
session from ovn-controller to the OVN SB database.
By default this it is 5s which not be sufficient in
loaded systems or during high control-plane activity spikes,
leading to unnecessary reconnections to OVSDB server.
Now it is extended by default to 1 min and it
is configurable.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675918
Change-Id: Ie7cb761ad3b4a180990de2916d6210d15ec0bf50
Closes-Bug: #1836604
'}, {'created': '2019-08-13 17:30:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add the ability to configure ovn-remote-probe-interval

This parameter sets inactive probe interval of the JSON
session from ovn-controller to the OVN SB database.
By default this it is 5s which not be sufficient in
loaded systems or during high control-plane activity spikes,
leading to unnecessary reconnections to OVSDB server.
Now it is extended by default to 1 min and it
is configurable.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675918
Change-Id: Ie7cb761ad3b4a180990de2916d6210d15ec0bf50
Closes-Bug: #1836604
(cherry picked from commit 942dd1367eb1e379528569e719e5b9df45684857)

commit_message:
Add the ability to configure ovn-remote-probe-interval

This parameter sets inactive probe interval of the JSON
session from ovn-controller to the OVN SB database.
By default this it is 5s which not be sufficient in
loaded systems or during high control-plane activity spikes,
leading to unnecessary reconnections to OVSDB server.
Now it is extended by default to 1 min and it
is configurable.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675918
Change-Id: Ie7cb761ad3b4a180990de2916d6210d15ec0bf50
Closes-Bug: #1836604
(cherry picked from commit 942dd1367eb1e379528569e719e5b9df45684857)

[{'created': '2019-08-06 07:05:51.000000000', 'message': 'Pentest-NC Nagios – API Handling – HTTP Security Headers Not Present

Added new X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header to make sure the browser
does not try to detect a different Content-Type than what is actually
sent (can lead to XSS)

Added new X-Frame-Options: sameorigin header to protect against
drag and drop clickjacking attacks in older browsers

Added new Content-Security-Policy: script-src self for implementation

Added new HTTP Security header X-XSS-Protection:1 mode=block to
sanitize the page, when a XSS attack is detected, the browser will
prevent rendering of the page

commit_message:
Nagios – API Handling – HTTP Security Headers Not Present

Added new X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header to make sure the browser
does not try to detect a different Content-Type than what is actually
sent (can lead to XSS)

Added new X-Frame-Options: sameorigin header to protect against
drag and drop clickjacking attacks in older browsers

Added new Content-Security-Policy: script-src self for implementation

Added new HTTP Security header X-XSS-Protection:1 mode=block to
sanitize the page, when a XSS attack is detected, the browser will
prevent rendering of the page

Change-Id: Ic79bbb96484a7f1a497c001883783338fd26a47a

commit_message:
Disable cephfs provisioner in multinode jobs

This disables the cephfs provisioner in the multinode
periodic jobs. It seems the helm tests for the ceph
provisioner chart that test cephfs fail more often than
not in the multinode jobs while passing reliably in the
single node check and gate jobs. As cephfs is still
gated, disabling the cephfs provisioner in the periodic
jobs allows for further investigation into this issue
without causing potential regressions

Change-Id: I36e68cc2e446afac8769fb9ab753105909341f24
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-10 09:59:12.000000000', 'message': 'Clear skb mark on encapsulating packets

Looks like by default OVS tunnels inherit skb marks from
tunneled packets. As a result Neutron IPTables marks set in
qrouter namespace are inherited by VXLAN encapsulating packets.
These marks may conflict with marks used by underlying networking
(like Calico) and lead to VXLAN tunneled packets being dropped.

This patch ensures that skb marks are cleared by OVS before entering
a tunnel to avoid conflicts with IPTables rules in default namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1839252
Change-Id: Id029be51bffe4188dd7f2155db16b21d19da1698
(cherry picked from commit 762773525234814c1c47b5d21e072a30a94ff9e6)
'}, {'created': '2019-08-12 13:24:09.000000000', 'message': 'Clear skb mark on encapsulating packets

Looks like by default OVS tunnels inherit skb marks from
tunneled packets. As a result Neutron IPTables marks set in
qrouter namespace are inherited by VXLAN encapsulating packets.
These marks may conflict with marks used by underlying networking
(like Calico) and lead to VXLAN tunneled packets being dropped.

This patch ensures that skb marks are cleared by OVS before entering
a tunnel to avoid conflicts with IPTables rules in default namespace.

commit_message:
Clear skb mark on encapsulating packets

Looks like by default OVS tunnels inherit skb marks from
tunneled packets. As a result Neutron IPTables marks set in
qrouter namespace are inherited by VXLAN encapsulating packets.
These marks may conflict with marks used by underlying networking
(like Calico) and lead to VXLAN tunneled packets being dropped.

This patch ensures that skb marks are cleared by OVS before entering
a tunnel to avoid conflicts with IPTables rules in default namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1839252
Change-Id: Id029be51bffe4188dd7f2155db16b21d19da1698
(cherry picked from commit 762773525234814c1c47b5d21e072a30a94ff9e6)

commit_message:
Microversion 2.75 - Multiple API cleanup changes

The compute APIs have been changed as API microversion 2.75
in I9d257a003d315b84b937dcef91f3cb41f3e24b53.
It is not necessary to change CLIs and Python API bindings.
So just bump support microversion up in python-novaclient.

Change-Id: If578c3b1f55c1584939bf09555a83d19c7bb9ce7
Implements: blueprint api-consistency-cleanup

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-07 01:01:00.000000000', 'message': 'fix update port bug

when update port set body={"port": {}}, neutron server will return 500.

In function _process_port_binding_attributes(plugins/ml2/plugin.py),
when update port body={"port": {}}
attrs={}
vnic_type = attrs and attrs.get(portbindings.VNIC_TYPE)
vnic_type = {}
because attrs as False, will not execute attrs.get(portbindings.VNIC_TYPE)
vnic_type will be replicated as attrs.

Change-Id: I40d388543387ebdd72f26d761339c1829bef9413
Partial-bug: #1838396
(cherry picked from commit dd080c70b423a56a69abf7e52d1fee0cb7988c92)
'}]
commit_message:
fix update port bug

when update port set body={"port": {}}, neutron server will return 500.

In function _process_port_binding_attributes(plugins/ml2/plugin.py),
when update port body={"port": {}}
attrs={}
vnic_type = attrs and attrs.get(portbindings.VNIC_TYPE)
vnic_type = {}
because attrs as False, will not execute attrs.get(portbindings.VNIC_TYPE)
vnic_type will be replicated as attrs.

Change-Id: I40d388543387ebdd72f26d761339c1829bef9413
Partial-bug: #1838396
(cherry picked from commit dd080c70b423a56a69abf7e52d1fee0cb7988c92)

[{'created': '2019-08-12 08:16:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sort issue in test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.test_filter_bindings

The test creates a list of networks, and then acts on a list of
NetworkDhcpAgentBindings obtained from get_objects() not guaranteed to

Make sure that returned list is sorted on network_id, and network_ids
itself sorted so both lists match

Closes-Bug: #1839595
(cherry picked from commit f59b6a470620eaf53c98f4d98801789c95ed9a26)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sort issue in test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.test_filter_bindings

The test creates a list of networks, and then acts on a list of
NetworkDhcpAgentBindings obtained from get_objects() not guaranteed to
follow the original build order (based on the network_ids list)

Make sure that returned list is sorted on network_id, and network_ids
itself sorted so both lists match

Change-Id: I9b07255988f7ba6609af1961b3429c3ce12d5186
Closes-Bug: #1839595
(cherry picked from commit f59b6a470620eaf53c98f4d98801789c95ed9a26)

a volume can be attached to an instance more than once.

the invalid attachment records.

commit_message:
Prevent double-attachment race in attachment_reserve

If multiple attachments are requested simultaneously,
a volume can be attached to an instance more than once.

This fixes this problem by detecting that a race has
occurred in _attachment_reserve, and backing out one of
the invalid attachment records.

This means that if the attachment API is called
repeatedly and quickly for the same volume, some requests
may fail, but this is much better than incorrectly
creating multiple attachments.

Closes-Bug: #1833736

Change-Id: Ic2463338b698c5cf805c0ae06d0229f54f64b3fc
(cherry picked from commit 7f3a77b66f9aa1b185310c8cbe33b358da6cc39a)
(cherry picked from commit eadff0df7efbe662bf107f77e1b2ac96c912e4e0)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/attachments/test_attachments_api.py
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/673851/

commit_message:
Remove python shebangs from python modules

This commit removes python shebangs from the python modules. They're
just python modules, so we don't need to have python shebangs for them.

Change-Id: I6f4428cf20be6f5ef2142030b4ede235444a4336

commit_message:
Minikube: Expose Tiller http port for metrics

This updates the Minikube deployment to patch the tiller-deploy
service to add a port definition for the http (44135) port for
tiller, which is used to expose metrics for Prometheus to scrape

Change-Id: I2eb5d4001c37935674ce64012b2744030addc127
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

This is great. I'm going to hold off on +Wing in case mriedem wants to swing back around but you can have my +2"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-08-12 09:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

There may be fixes wanted in a follow up for mriedem gets back, but this is awesome, so lets get it in.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-12 09:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-12 13:45:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've just encountered a situation where this seems to work poorly, and effectively causes context switching problems for eventlet.

As far as I can tell, when there's an RPC somewhere within the method being profiled it will slow things way down and report weird data, for example with _update_available_resource in the resource tracker. And then sometimes it will just break message entirely, for example in _update_usage_from_instance

I'll keep investigating to see if I can find out why, but I guess a big ass warning at the top of the doc may be warranted. Which is really frustrating."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-12 14:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For my testing, it seems I can get around this by allowing the n-cpu process to talk to the database instead of using the conductor. Dare we document that?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-12 15:13:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Matt has [1] which seems to imply that we should not be talking to the database from n-cpu. (Are we talking about the same database?)

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675714/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-12 18:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> For my testing, it seems I can get around this by allowing the n-cpu process to talk to the database instead of using the conductor. Dare we document that?

There used to be a configuration to allow n-cpu to hit the database directly (local conductor) but that was removed quite awhile ago, so anyone removing the indirection API for compute would have to patch that themselves, which might get tricky. It might be worth documenting a known issue though with a simple diff of how you patched nova/cmd/compute.py.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-08-13 07:54:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for writing this up Chris! ++'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-13 21:46:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> It might be worth
 > documenting a known issue though with a simple diff of how you
 > patched nova/cmd/compute.py.

Yeah, I think I'll do that in a fup. soon

ish"}]

commit_message:
Add a document that describes profiling eventlet services

Profiling eventlet using services is a bit different from standard
situations so here is a document that tries to explain the basics
on how to get started doing it.

[{'created': '2019-07-20 17:52:59.000000000', 'message': "Run 'tempest-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the new job 'tempest-ipv6-only'(adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6 and run smoke
tests and IPv6 related tests present in Tempest.

This job will be part of Nova, Neutron, Cinder, Keystone, Glance, Swift
gate.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'tempest-ipv6-only' will run the smoke + IPv6 related test case.

This commit adds the new job 'tempest-ipv6-only' run on gate.

Task: #35898

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671231/
