commit_message:
ACTIVE-ACTIVE Topology: Initial Distributor Driver Mixin

Implements: blueprint https://review.openstack.org/#/c/234639

Bolted the distriutor on  top of amphora with serveral
mixins. Added to Noop Driver. Improved Distributor
data structure. Resurrected teh distributor driver.

Change-Id: Ic143c3b5a24cdeb6444f26f965fc57c1a88e1fb8
Co-Authored-By: Valeria Perelman <perelman@il.ibm.com>

subject: Add a soft check for the allowed_address_pairs extension.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 9373, 'name': 'Vlad Gusev', 'email': 'vlad.esten@gmail.com', 'username': 's10'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27256, 'name': 'Vadim Ponomarev', 'email': 'velizarx@gmail.com', 'username': 'velizarx'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-05-15 10:22:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-05-15 13:02:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-05-15 20:01:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

It's named allowed_address_pairs for a reason -- it requires that feature to function. I'm not sure if continuing is even worthwhile if the extension isn't present.

That said, *maybe* without security groups, it just isn't necessary at all? Could that be true? Is it the use of security groups that adds the requirement of setting up AAPs?"}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-05-16 11:20:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, it's the main reason for this change. Allowed address pairs extension didn't work when you disable security_groups extension. See code: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/stable/queens/neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py#L49 This code automatically disables AAP extension.
But Octavia currently has SG soft check and AAP hard check. It's strange and not logical because one of the extension didn't work without another one.
When I started work with this problem, I thought that best way create new separate driver, but then I realized that the driver code will be 98% identical to the code allowed_address_pairs driver."}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-05-16 22:46:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Ok, I'll have to figure out the easiest way to test this in devstack."}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-05-23 17:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

We use allowed-address pair (AAP) so we can "move" the VIP IP from one vm to the other by having it answer to two IPs. Not having the allowed-address pair extension prevents this from working. I can see a case where you don't need AAP when port security is disabled but this patch doesn't seem to cover that.'}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-05-31 08:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> We use allowed-address pair (AAP) so we can "move" the VIP IP from
 > one vm to the other by having it answer to two IPs. Not having the
 > allowed-address pair extension prevents this from working. I can
 > see a case where you don't need AAP when port security is disabled
 > but this patch doesn't seem to cover that.
Yes, this case actual when we disable all port_security functionality. AFAIU, do you propose to check the status of port_security extension instead of AAP? And if the port_security disabled don't we use AAP and SG?'}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-05-31 08:02:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, this case actual when we disable all port_security functionality. AFAIU, do you propose to check the status of port_security extension instead of AAP? And if the port_security disabled don't we use AAP and SG?"}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-06-04 08:52:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Vadim,
I think that if AAP does not work without Neutron security_groups, to begin with, we should check that first.

That said, I really never tried to use Octavia without AAP and sec_groups so if you submit such a patch-set and confirm that it is working, I'll test it locally.

P.S.
1. Also, I'm not so sure about the driver renaming that you did.
2. Per German's comment about VIP migration between VMs we should test this very carefully.
3. Is this a real use-case? or are you just aiming to fix the order of the checks?"}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-06-04 10:20:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hm, I agree, check SG is will be the best way.

1. but what is the point to leave a name if the driver can work without AAP extension?
2. VIP migration works fine if port_security disabled and prevent_arp_spoofing = False, I already use this functionality in my local OpenStack installation
3. yes, this is real use-case. We have a big public cloud installation based on OpenStack and we don't use SG and port_security. See our discussion in maillist http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128635.html"}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-10-22 10:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-10-22 15:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-10-23 13:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9373, 'date': '2018-11-05 11:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-12-05 19:01:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

We now swallow the error that AAP is not enabled (even if port  security is not enabled). System should still raise an exception in this scenario so we don't attempt things which won't work."}]

[{'created': '2018-05-15 10:22:56.000000000', 'message': "Add a soft check for the allowed_address_pairs extension.

If we disable security_groups extension (like enable_security_group
= False) on neutron server that neutron server will disable
allowed_address_pairs too (see code neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py).
Currently, Octavia's driver for neutron supports disabled
security_groups but fails with disabled allowed_address_pairs
extension (shows error and stops).

This patch adds a soft check for allowed_address_pairs extension,
and if the extension was disabled the driver just won't use this
functionality. Since the patch adds soft check, I renamed this
driver from 'allowed_address_pairs' to in a more general
'neutron_driver'. It all will make Octavia's configuration more
flexibility.

commit_message:
Add a soft check for the allowed_address_pairs extension.

If we disable security_groups extension (like enable_security_group
= False) on neutron server that neutron server will disable
allowed_address_pairs too (see code neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py).
Currently, Octavia's driver for neutron supports disabled
security_groups but fails with disabled allowed_address_pairs
extension (shows error and stops).

This patch adds a soft check for allowed_address_pairs extension,
and if the extension was disabled the driver just won't use this
functionality. It makes Octavia's configuration more flexibility.

Change-Id: Ieb8242adb78d5f66d77a1061c16e90497845b9b7
Story: 2001718

[{'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-12-19 16:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-12-19 16:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

This change warns a release note with an item in the "upgrade" section.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-12-19 16:27:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We cannot change configuration options without backwards compatibility and a deprecation period.
Why don't we make these changes, but add the existing options as deprecated, but compatible options? See the bottom of the file."}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-12-19 18:23:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> We cannot change configuration options without backwards
 > compatibility and a deprecation period.
 > Why don't we make these changes, but add the existing options as

See the bottom file? Can you elaborate?"}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-01-04 18:29:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The bottom of the file I commented on, config.py has a method called "def handle_deprecation_compatibility():" that has code we setup to handle backwards compatibility during deprecation cycles.'}]

[{'created': '2018-12-19 16:03:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix config options

The configuration options mentioned "threads" however processes were
actually spawned. This commit renames "threads" to workers, which will
give us the ability to switch back to threads if there is ever a need
to.

Change-Id: I5cd2ca16817d9f7ee24fe3461d4c7beaa9a22875
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config options

The configuration options mentioned "threads" however processes were
actually spawned. This commit renames "threads" to workers, which will
give us the ability to switch back to threads if there is ever a need
to.

Change-Id: I5cd2ca16817d9f7ee24fe3461d4c7beaa9a22875

[{'created': '2019-08-05 12:47:48.000000000', 'message': "iLO firmware update fails with 'update_firmware_sum' clean step

Firmware update using 'update_firmware_sum' clean step fails with
an error stating that unable to connect to iLO address due to
authentication failure.
The 'update_firmware_sum' is an inband clean step wherein the
firmware ISO was inserted from IPA ramdisk. As part of security
fix to ironic the BMC credentials are no more passed to the IPA
ramdisk. The attempt to connect to iLO from IPA ramdisk fails.
The fix has been made to insert the firmware ISO from the
conductor.

Change-Id: I866330c5fc98b1c5bc042c296c3b6e76ed9fd57d
Story: 2006223
Task: 35821

commit_message:
iLO firmware update fails with 'update_firmware_sum' clean step

Firmware update using 'update_firmware_sum' clean step fails with
an error stating that unable to connect to iLO address due to
authentication failure.
The 'update_firmware_sum' is an inband clean step wherein the
firmware ISO was inserted from IPA ramdisk. As part of security
fix to ironic the BMC credentials are no more passed to the IPA
ramdisk. The attempt to connect to iLO from IPA ramdisk fails.
The fix has been made to insert the firmware ISO from the
conductor.

Change-Id: I866330c5fc98b1c5bc042c296c3b6e76ed9fd57d
Story: 2006223
Task: 35821
(cherry picked from commit 50bfd9067fdeebcc89117ddab4fdd1573dba565e)

commit_message:
Do not use yaml.load(file)

Now a Loader is required, as the default loader is considered unsafe.
See [1] for details.

[1] https://msg.pyyaml.org/load

Change-Id: I08af1afd6df097fab33701db89c656ebfe981b30

subject: moved generic util functions from mistral to mistral-lib
messages:
[{'account_id': 30755, 'date': '2019-08-07 10:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-07 10:37:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30755, 'date': '2019-08-07 10:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-08-07 10:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Generally looks good. I'm just thinking whether we need to move filter_utils into mistral-lib or not. Because it's kind of a specific functionality and explicitly mentions REST. I'd probably leave it in mistral for now."}, {'account_id': 30755, 'date': '2019-08-08 07:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-08-08 07:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2019-08-08 07:55:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I don't think this is a good idea.

We should remove duplicated code from Mistral (and update functions to the most recent version in Mistral). However, there is no benefit that I can see to moving the other unused functions from mistral to mistral-lib."}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2019-08-13 07:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-08-13 07:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix networking-midonet CI job run on Neutron check queue

It seems that this job is failing due to expired SSL certificate on
midonet server.
So lets use http address for now as a workaround for this issue until
it will be fixed on midonet side.

Change-Id: I3d092a9f9c0263d381948dec267ae4d9db0c0ac3
Related-bug: #1714846

commit_message:
Revert "Change haproxy http-check expect for nova_console"

The proxy services are sending an empty response body so the backends
are actually being marked as down.

This reverts commit dc409a98e3d8b3c28cc884442776bd9b525cc851.

Change-Id: I6838bbf3875ad231dc0a1d3a2017a942fb1b4d9d

commit_message:
Fix the pypi element for multiple mirror URLs

The 'pypi' mirror element is generating invalid pip.conf files
when more than one "DIB_PYPI_MIRROR_URL" is specified.
This patch fixes the pip.conf file rendering to use a proper form
when there are multiple "extra_index_url" provided.

Closes-Bug: #1839558
Change-Id: Ibda0e7390955683560e09b486f636775643ff57c

commit_message:
Create /etc/machine-id for RHEL images

Per the inline comment, a machine-id is required for kernels to
install correctly (this may well be a bug, but the linked issue
remained inconclusive).

Add a call to make the machine-id before install packages.

Change-Id: If75d04376e62bfdfe14ee3ca4d0bd5c8b383c1b0
Redhat-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1737355

[{'created': '2019-08-08 14:42:09.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure directories managed by libvirt-daemon exist

The /var/run/libvirt directory is managed by libvirt-daemon. As
this service is now running within a container, the directory
might not exists on a fresh install.
This patch also takes care of the fact the /var/run directory is
cleaned upon reboot, and uses systemd-tmpfiles in order to ensure
the directory creation during the boot process.

We also take care of missing log directories, also managed by the
libvirt-daemon package.

Change-Id: I6f8dc49ff556215a25e8bb23ae8da63ce607d70c
Closes-Bug: #1801977
(cherry picked from commit f65664ff56de26b6e98ffcf09001427e5a8bdaf3)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure directories managed by libvirt-daemon exist

The /var/run/libvirt directory is managed by libvirt-daemon. As
this service is now running within a container, the directory
might not exists on a fresh install.
This patch also takes care of the fact the /var/run directory is
cleaned upon reboot, and uses systemd-tmpfiles in order to ensure
the directory creation during the boot process.

We also take care of missing log directories, also managed by the
libvirt-daemon package.

Change-Id: I6f8dc49ff556215a25e8bb23ae8da63ce607d70c
Closes-Bug: #1801977
(cherry picked from commit f65664ff56de26b6e98ffcf09001427e5a8bdaf3)

subject: Force "Pre-cache" tasks to run in dry run
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-08-09 13:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-08-12 06:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-12 14:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-12 18:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-09 13:30:56.000000000', 'message': 'Force "Pre-cache" tasks to run in dry run

We don't want the pre-cache tasks to be skipped in dry-run so we force
check_mode to "no".

For example, "command" is skipped in check mode because we don't provide
"creates" nor "removes"; and since we need to cache facts when running Puppet
in dry mode, we need to make sure this task is run anyway.

See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/command_module.html

For "file", "copy", and "synchronize", they aren't skipped in dry mode
but the resources aren't executed for real.

So this patch disable check_mode for all these tasks.
We also move the tasks in a block which avoid tags & check_mode
duplication for each task and avoid problems in the future if a task is
added.

Closes-Bug: #1839321
Change-Id: I21524419b8b416d0879fc61aa3274d2e30537438
(cherry picked from commit 9581614e9353576c6a7b83136793631473851b31)
'}]
commit_message:
Force "Pre-cache" tasks to run in dry run

We don't want the pre-cache tasks to be skipped in dry-run so we force
check_mode to "no".

For example, "command" is skipped in check mode because we don't provide
"creates" nor "removes"; and since we need to cache facts when running Puppet
in dry mode, we need to make sure this task is run anyway.

See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/command_module.html

For "file", "copy", and "synchronize", they aren't skipped in dry mode
but the resources aren't executed for real.

So this patch disable check_mode for all these tasks.
We also move the tasks in a block which avoid tags & check_mode
duplication for each task and avoid problems in the future if a task is
added.

Closes-Bug: #1839321
Change-Id: I21524419b8b416d0879fc61aa3274d2e30537438
(cherry picked from commit 9581614e9353576c6a7b83136793631473851b31)

[{'created': '2019-08-09 15:30:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix retaging of ovn-dbs container during update.

The variable name was wrong, and the retaging was not taking place
leading to ovn dbs being stopped on the cluster after update.

Change-Id: I9f3502be850a48f2aaf018c7cde0fea253a1513a
Closes-Bug: #1839635
'}]
commit_message:
Fix retaging of ovn-dbs container during update.

The variable name was wrong, and the retaging was not taking place
leading to ovn dbs being stopped on the cluster after update.

Change-Id: I9f3502be850a48f2aaf018c7cde0fea253a1513a
Closes-Bug: #1839635

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: I5e29862196d4e615d49db8c214c4419239424567

"}, {'created': '2019-08-12 20:52:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix DF broken gate

This commit is a squash of 3 different commits required to fix
DragonFlow gate (See below).

Upgrade redis driver

Redis python package API was changed over time, while we did not
change our handling of the code.
In the gate the driver was updated, and the gate tests were broken.
Updated the code in a way that supports both python2 (soon to be
obsoleted) and python3.
Updated the requirements to install new versions of the packages.

Remove testing revision number in test_df_qos_driver

This code tests Neutron behaviour of increasing the revision number.
This is not code that is controlled by Dragonflow. If (when) it fails,
Dragonflow cannot fix it generically.

use payloads for ROUTER_GATEWAY events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for ROUTER_GATEWAY events for those that are not using them yet.
The unit tests are also updated where needed to account for the
payload style callbacks and publish() method. Finally the patch
normalizes the passing of gateway IPs which are currently referred to
as 'gw_ips' and 'gateway_ips' depending on the event; now all events use
'gateway_ips'.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/638274/

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Co-Authored-By: Omer Anson <omer.anson@toganetworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: boden <bodenvmw@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I5cd456028ed8af86c6c512e514eb91cec56ea77c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DF broken gate

This commit is a squash of 3 different commits required to fix
DragonFlow gate (See below).

Upgrade redis driver

Redis python package API was changed over time, while we did not
change our handling of the code.
In the gate the driver was updated, and the gate tests were broken.
Updated the code in a way that supports both python2 (soon to be
obsoleted) and python3.
Updated the requirements to install new versions of the packages.

Remove testing revision number in test_df_qos_driver

This code tests Neutron behaviour of increasing the revision number.
This is not code that is controlled by Dragonflow. If (when) it fails,
Dragonflow cannot fix it generically.

use payloads for ROUTER_GATEWAY events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for ROUTER_GATEWAY events for those that are not using them yet.
The unit tests are also updated where needed to account for the
payload style callbacks and publish() method. Finally the patch
normalizes the passing of gateway IPs which are currently referred to
as 'gw_ips' and 'gateway_ips' depending on the event; now all events use
'gateway_ips'.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/638274/

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Co-Authored-By: Omer Anson <omer.anson@toganetworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: boden <bodenvmw@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I5cd456028ed8af86c6c512e514eb91cec56ea77c

subject: Ensure we get a subnet for ctlplane
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17823, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@redhat.com', 'username': 'mbaldessari'}, {'_account_id': 18851, 'name': 'Marius Cornea', 'email': 'mcornea@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcornea'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jensås', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-08-12 05:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-08-12 09:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-08-12 09:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-08-12 10:29:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-08-12 12:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-08-12 13:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Herald, this was merged in master already and was a clean cherry-pick

we can work on a better fix though'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-08-12 14:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Herald, this was merged in master already and was a clean
 > cherry-pick
 > 
 > we can work on a better fix though

I am fairly sure the problem here is that the environment files did'nt include the data we document they should. 'OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::ControlPlaneVipPort' was overriden to use the 'deployed-server/deployed-neutron-port.yaml' template. And the 'control_virtual_ip' section in 'DeployedServerPortMap' did not have the 'tags' specifying the list of cidrs of the ctlplane subnets. (see example below pointing out what I think was missing)

I don't think it's possible to fix in code. We put a list of all the cidr's of the ctlplane subnets into the 'tags' field of the ctlplane network on the undercloud, this happens during undercloud deploy. We need a neutron port on the ctlplane network to be able to read the tags in Heat. Since we override the ControlPlaneVipPort so that a "fake" neutron port is created, we have no other way than updating the DeployedServerPortMap to include the list of cidr's as the network[tags] value of the "fake" port.


  resource_registry:
    OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::ControlPlaneVipPort: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/deployed-server/deployed-neutron-port.yaml

  parameter_defaults:
    DeployedServerPortMap:
      control_virtual_ip:
        fixed_ips:
          - ip_address: 192.168.100.1
        subnets:
          - cidr: 192.168.100.0/24
        network:      <- MISSING
          tags:       <- MISSING 
            - 192.168.100.0/24  <- MISSING


To some extent, this fix re-introduces https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1834161 for deployed-server? We need to update the downstream doc's[1] section to include adding the the network tags. (If including that data in DeployedServerPortMap does not work, we need to figure out why and ensure it does.


[1] https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_openstack_platform/15-beta/html-single/director_installation_and_usage/index#using-a-separate-network-for-pre-provisioned-nodes'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-08-13 06:06:09.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as Iee4a159c8b73753778cf43eb5ed5c57c13b29a20'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-12 05:37:25.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure we get a subnet for ctlplane

It might happen the ServiceData['net_cidr_map']['ctlplane'] has a "null"
value, preventing tripleo::firewall to set the proper firewall rule for
ctlplane SSH access.

This patch creates a conditions ensuring we have a value for that
parameter, and if not, fetches the value out of Hiera.

Closes-Bug: #1839324
Change-Id: I84cdb47f40df546162f1244e99c2391fd71daad7
(cherry picked from commit 9e5efd591101928daa7337f4b7a4b076fab24ff8)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure we get a subnet for ctlplane

It might happen the ServiceData['net_cidr_map']['ctlplane'] has a "null"
value, preventing tripleo::firewall to set the proper firewall rule for
ctlplane SSH access.

This patch creates a conditions ensuring we have a value for that
parameter, and if not, fetches the value out of Hiera.

Closes-Bug: #1839324
Change-Id: I84cdb47f40df546162f1244e99c2391fd71daad7
(cherry picked from commit 9e5efd591101928daa7337f4b7a4b076fab24ff8)

commit_message:
Ensure we get a subnet for ctlplane

It might happen the ServiceData['net_cidr_map']['ctlplane'] has a "null"
value, preventing tripleo::firewall to set the proper firewall rule for
ctlplane SSH access.

This patch creates a conditions ensuring we have a value for that
parameter, and if not, fetches the value out of Hiera.

Closes-Bug: #1839324
Change-Id: I84cdb47f40df546162f1244e99c2391fd71daad7

[{'account_id': 30788, 'date': '2019-08-06 18:49:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-06 18:49:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Fix default network in barbican deployment

This patch adds the default network for barbican_init_atos_directory
when atos hsm is enabled.

Change-Id: Ia7673a127a43b3a230b39ce70440d53609ca62bb

(3 comments)

Thanks for the update Alexandra, the patch itself it fine to me except for a little nit. Please allow me to use this opportunity to discuss some more general issues with my co-reviewers, though.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-10 03:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-10 03:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-10 03:30:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fixing 404 link

Did not specify between 2.8 and 2.7, went with
generic documentation link for ease of future use.

Change-Id: I43c5f71c9b335055ee8691566eb662fdb27eeba8
backport: stein rocky

commit_message:
Set 'distro_python_version' variable

We use that variable in Kolla in many places. There are places in
'kolla-ansible' where we also need it.

Change-Id: Iea78c4a7cb0fd1405ea7299cdcf0841f63820c8c

When sending the broker request to create (or grant access to) the pool,
it assumed the pool name was the unit name and did not check the
config('rbd-pool-name') override value even though that was used in the

commit_message:
rbd-pool-name was not used when creating the pool

When sending the broker request to create (or grant access to) the pool,
it assumed the pool name was the unit name and did not check the
config('rbd-pool-name') override value even though that was used in the
configuration file.

Change-Id: Ie8d0577b5f0aea045fcc724e136a457c36d466fe
Closes-Bug: #1839906

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 21:39:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add InstanceAction/Event create() method

During a cross-cell resize, the instance and its
related records are created in the target cell. Since
the resize is initiated in the source cell, instance
actions and associated events will be created in the
source cell and need to be re-created in the target cell
where the resize completes. Not only that, but we want
to also make sure the history of actions performed on
an instance are copied into the target cell database
in case the resize is confirmed there.

This adds a create() method for the InstanceAction
and InstanceActionEvent objects to allow directly
re-creating those resources from the source cell into
the target cell.

The existing action_start() and event_start() methods
will not work for this scenario since those depend on the
current context but we need to clone actions/events created
with an older/different context.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I43db251f708c18eb35efe1fdbcdada35ae7e792c

source cell and need to be re-created in the target cell
where the resize completes. Not only that, but we want
to also make sure the history of actions performed on
an instance are copied into the target cell database
in case the resize is confirmed there.

This adds a create() method for the InstanceAction
and InstanceActionEvent objects to allow directly
re-creating those resources from the source cell into
the target cell.

The existing action_start() and event_start() methods
will not work for this scenario since those depend on the
current context but we need to clone actions/events created
with an older/different context.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I43db251f708c18eb35efe1fdbcdada35ae7e792c

commit_message:
Add InstanceAction/Event create() method

During a cross-cell resize, the instance and its
related records are created in the target cell. Since
the resize is initiated in the source cell, instance
actions and associated events will be created in the
source cell and need to be re-created in the target cell
where the resize completes. Not only that, but we want
to also make sure the history of actions performed on
an instance are copied into the target cell database
in case the resize is confirmed there.

This adds a create() method for the InstanceAction
and InstanceActionEvent objects to allow directly
re-creating those resources from the source cell into
the target cell.

The existing action_start() and event_start() methods
will not work for this scenario since those depend on the
current context but we need to clone actions/events created
with an older/different context.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I43db251f708c18eb35efe1fdbcdada35ae7e792c

subject: [DVR] Add lock during creation of FIP agent gateway port

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-12 08:15:54.000000000', 'message': "[DVR] Add lock during creation of FIP agent gateway port

In case when new external network is set as gateway network for
dvr router, neutron tries to create floating IP agent gateway port.
There should be always max 1 such port per network per L3 agent but
sometimes when there are 2 requests to set external gateway for 2
different routers executed almost in same time it may happend that
there will be 2 such ports created.
That will cause error with configuration of one of routers on L3 agent
and this will cause e.g. problems with access from VMs to metadata
service.
Such issues are visible in DVR CI jobs from time to time. Please check
related bug for details.

This patch adds lock mechanism during creation of such FIP gateway port.
Such solution isn't fully solving exising race condition as if 2
requests will be processed by api workers running on 2 different nodes
than this race can still happend.
But this should mitigate the issue a bit and solve problem in U/S gates
at least.
For proper fix we should probably add some constraint on database level
to prevent creation of 2 such ports for one network and one host but
such solution will not be easy to backport to stable branches so I would
prefer first to go with this easy workaround.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py

Change-Id: Iabab7e4d36c7d6a876b2b74423efd7106a5f63f6
Related-Bug: #1830763
(cherry picked from commit 7b81c1bc67d2d85e03b4c96a8c1c558a2f909836)
"}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Add lock during creation of FIP agent gateway port

In case when new external network is set as gateway network for
dvr router, neutron tries to create floating IP agent gateway port.
There should be always max 1 such port per network per L3 agent but
sometimes when there are 2 requests to set external gateway for 2
different routers executed almost in same time it may happend that
there will be 2 such ports created.
That will cause error with configuration of one of routers on L3 agent
and this will cause e.g. problems with access from VMs to metadata
service.
Such issues are visible in DVR CI jobs from time to time. Please check
related bug for details.

This patch adds lock mechanism during creation of such FIP gateway port.
Such solution isn't fully solving exising race condition as if 2
requests will be processed by api workers running on 2 different nodes
than this race can still happend.
But this should mitigate the issue a bit and solve problem in U/S gates
at least.
For proper fix we should probably add some constraint on database level
to prevent creation of 2 such ports for one network and one host but
such solution will not be easy to backport to stable branches so I would
prefer first to go with this easy workaround.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py

Change-Id: Iabab7e4d36c7d6a876b2b74423efd7106a5f63f6
Related-Bug: #1830763
(cherry picked from commit 7b81c1bc67d2d85e03b4c96a8c1c558a2f909836)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - QoS Utils Move

Previoulsy, QoS complimentary static methods were located
in the rest.py file, these are better placed in the file
utils.py.  This change addresses that move to utils.py.

Change-Id: I47cbdbd443e0050a4f4349bf177dd06d807eb56f

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I89e0cbc68b4249ad2d69fba98ceabc9ac146763f

commit_message:
Add the ability to configure ovn-remote-probe-interval

This parameter sets inactive probe interval of the JSON
session from ovn-controller to the OVN SB database.
By default this it is 5s which not be sufficient in
loaded systems or during high control-plane activity spikes,
leading to unnecessary reconnections to OVSDB server.
Now it is extended by default to 1 min and it
is configurable.

Change-Id: If8684927b17fc9f7ee4cca277b8b0ca9c4d8b5e1
Partial-Bug: #1836604
(cherry picked from commit 2d401a869fd5ba264533f3046c8de5e585b48be6)
(cherry picked from commit f68e399cf11f2b3ae6bb74babf04e76e9d0503c2)

commit_message:
Add the ability to configure ovn-remote-probe-interval

This parameter sets inactive probe interval of the JSON
session from ovn-controller to the OVN SB database.
By default this it is 5s which not be sufficient in
loaded systems or during high control-plane activity spikes,
leading to unnecessary reconnections to OVSDB server.
Now it is extended by default to 1 min and it
is configurable.

Change-Id: If8684927b17fc9f7ee4cca277b8b0ca9c4d8b5e1
Partial-Bug: #1836604
(cherry picked from commit 2d401a869fd5ba264533f3046c8de5e585b48be6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-15 16:24:48.000000000', 'message': "backup, ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>

commit_message:
Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>

commit_message:
Implement power_off/power_on for the FakeDriver

When trying to recreate hundreds of instance action
events for scale testing with the FakeDriver, a nice
simple way to do that is by stopping those instances
and starting them again.

However, since power_off/on aren't implemented, once
you "stop" them the sync_instance_power_state periodic
task in the compute manager thinks they are still running
on the "hypervisor" and will stop them again via the API,
which records yet another instance action and set of
events.

This just toggles the power state bit on the fake instance
in the FakeDriver to make the periodic task do the right
thing.

As a result, we also have more realistic API and
notification samples.

Change-Id: Ie621686053ad774c4ae4f22bb2a455f98900b611
(cherry picked from commit 211e9b1961a14e22b39194fdd90e40738fc27202)
(cherry picked from commit 4a3eea8c30f5a452bcf82b145c66de3d3416a1cd)
